bibl.title: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, January 13, 1916

div1.p: Stimpson requests that Carter detail his expenses for reimbursement.

div1.head: Letter from W.G. Stimpson to Henry Rose Carter, January 13, 1916
div1.opener:
AM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 13, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have to acknowledge the receipt of your let-
ters of December 9 and January 10, relative to pay-
ment of charges for your care in hospital at Birmingham,
Ala.

You are requested to have prepared a voucher in
favor of the hospital in which you were treated, on
form 1949, for submission to the authorities of said
hospital for signature, covering cost of your care
and treatment therein. Upon receipt of this voucher,
the same will be forwarded for signature, and the
hospital instructed to refund to you money already
paid by you for your treatment in same.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, W G Stimpson
Assistant Surgeon General.
